user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest (enum MHD_DigestAuthAlgo3 algo3,
                                 const char *username,
                                 const char *realm,
                                 const char *password,
                                 void *userdigest_bin,
                                 size_t bin_buf_size)
{
  struct DigestAlgorithm da;
  enum MHD_Result ret;
  if (! digest_init_one_time (&da, get_base_digest_algo (algo3)))
    return MHD_NO;

  if (digest_get_size (&da) > bin_buf_size)
    ret = MHD_NO;
  else
  {
    calc_userdigest (&da,
                     username,
                     strlen (username),
                     realm,
                     strlen (realm),
                     password,
                     userdigest_bin);
    ret = MHD_YES;

#ifdef MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR
    if (digest_ext_error (&da))
      ret = MHD_NO;
#endif /* MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR */
  }
  digest_deinit (&da);

  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
calc_userdigest (&da,
                     username,
                     strlen (username),
                     realm,
                     strlen (realm),
                     password,
                     userdigest_bin);
explanation: Only function calls (and the conditional compilation block that contains a call) are reported because MISRA C:2023 Rule 17.2 concerns functions calling themselves directly or indirectly. These reported fragments are the points where control flows into other functions that might (directly or indirectly) call back to MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest and therefore must be investigated for recursion. Other parts of the function do not invoke other functions (declarations, enum/variable definitions, simple assignments, use of literal macros MHD_YES/MHD_NO, the return statement, and the surrounding control-flow structure) and thus cannot by themselves create direct or indirect self-calls, so they do not need further investigation for Rule 17.2.
